version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Portrait and role symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A male face, of adult age.Â Differentiated from theÂ boyÂ emoji on AndroidÂ by the lack ofÂ a cap, and on iOS by aÂ moustache.Â Difficult to discer http://emojipedia.org/man/
emoji_net_data.name: man

bn:00106355a: Inherently characteristic of the male of a species.
Having the characteristics of a man.

bn:00098829a: (of a person) possessing physical strength and weight; rugged and powerful
Possessing physical strength and weight; rugged and powerful; powerfully or heavily built.
Possessing physical strength and weight; rugged and powerful.

bn:00009361n: The hair growing on the lower part of a man's face
A beard that covers a large part of the face.
Facial hair on the chin, cheeks and jaw.
A growth of facial hair between the nose and the upper lip.
Facial hair of humans on the chin, cheeks and jaw.
A beard growth visible late in the day on a man whose face was clean-shaven in the morning.
A hairstyle where facial hair is shaven except for the area between the chin and the neck.
A style of facial hair wherein the beard is allowed to grow down the chin and is trimmed to an even length over the entirety of the face.

Whiskers or vibrissae are a type of mammalian hair that are typically characterised, anatomically, by their large size, large and well-innervated hair follicle and by having an identifiable representation in the somatosensory cortex of the brain.
That part of the beard which grows upon the sides of the face, usually of the male, or upon the chin, or upon both.
A beard is the collection of hair that grows on the chin, upper lip, cheeks and neck of human beings and some non-human animals.
A beard is the hair that grows on a human chin, cheeks, neck and the area above the upper lip.

bn:00024989n: An informal term for a father; probably derived from baby talk
Dad, daddy, father; a familiar or old-fashioned term of address to one's father.
Papa is a nickname which may refer to.

bn:00046516n: A person, especially as one among many.
An individual is a person or a specific object.
A single physical human being as a legal subject, as opposed to a legal person such as a corporation.
A human; someone susceptible to death.

A person is a being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood, which in turn is defined differently by different authors in different disciplines, and by different cultures in different times and places.
A person that will die eventually.
A being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood
Abstract term defining a being, e.g. a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood (not for use with "instance of" [P31], instead use "human" [Q5])
An individual; usually a human being.

bn:00001480n: A juvenile between the onset of puberty and maturity
A teenager; a juvenile after puberty.
A juvenile between the onset of puberty and maturity; in the state of development between puberty and maturity.

bn:00001533n: Sexual maturity is the age or stage when an organism can reproduce.
The age or stage when an organism can reproduce
A man is a male human.
An adult human member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
A human member of the masculine sex or gender.
An adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)

bn:00009616n: Male parent or Individual progenitor of human offspring
A male parent (also used as a term of address to your father)
The male parent whose child inherits one half of the parent's DNA and the Y chromosome.
A male ancestor more remote than a parent; a progenitor; especially, a first ancestor.
The man from whom one inherits half of one's DNA and from whom men inherit their Y chromosome.
The counterpart of a dam, particularly in animal breeding. See also stallion
Man from whom one inherits DNA.
A father is a male parent who has raised a child, supplied the sperm through sexual intercourse or sperm donation which grew into a child, and/or donated a body cell which resulted in a clone.
